intro: Scleromitrion rugosum, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, also known as the spurge family, and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its latex is milky and can be irritating to the skin, a common trait among members of this family. Scleromitrion rugosum is typically found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
